author: hmijail
content:
> What's the most efficient data structure you guys know of that is computed from a set, along with a binary operation on two of these data structures, that tells you if there's a set intersection? 
<@!213672586264051717> have you looked into minhash?

author: hmijail
content:
> The goal of MinHash is to estimate [the ratio between the number of elements of the intersection and union of 2 sets] quickly
... so if MinHash gives you 0, you know the sets are disjunct
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MinHash#Jaccard_similarity_and_minimum_hash_values

author: minaminao
content: https://ethervm.io/ is 502 since the other day, a great site that sums up the EVM Opcodes nicely. Isn't the maintainer here?
